message.content: This question tests knowledge about detecting earthquake activity caused by tectonic plate movement. When the earth's plates grind against each other, it creates seismic waves that can be detected using a seismograph. Option (A) and (B) are incorrect because a tape measure and ruler are used for measuring length and are not relevant to detecting tectonic plate movement. Option (D) is incorrect because a Geiger counter is used to detect radiation, not seismic activity.

This question requires knowledge about the tools used to detect and measure seismic activity. When the earth's tectonic plates grind against each other, it can cause earthquakes. The instrument used to detect and measure these seismic vibrations is called a seismograph. Option (A) and (B) are incorrect because a tape measure and a ruler are tools used for measuring length and are not related to detecting seismic activity. Option (D) is incorrect because a geiger counter is used to detect radiation, not seismic activity.

This question requires basic knowledge about the detection of tectonic plate movement and earthquakes. When the earth's plates grind against each other, it creates seismic waves which can be detected using a seismograph. A seismograph measures the intensity and duration of the seismic waves generated by the movement of the earth's plates. Option (A) and (B) are incorrect because a tape measure or ruler cannot measure these seismic waves. Option (D) is incorrect because a geiger counter is used to measure radiation, not seismic activity.
